title: Classification and Analysis of Educational Objectives: Application of Bloom’s Taxonomy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts of curriculum design and foundational understanding of Bloom’s taxonomy
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for current practitioners, emphasizing real-world applicability through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically classify educational objectives using Bloom’s Taxonomy 6 levels (Remembering, Understanding, Applying, Analyzing, Evaluating, Creating)
Learners can design specific and assessable objectives by selecting measurable verbs when stating learning goals
Learners can optimize learning outcomes by considering the balance of cognitive domains (lower/higher-order thinking skills) when designing curricula

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
